sen.j: 京都交通株式会社（きょうとこうつう）は、京都府北部でバス (交通機関)を運行する事業者である。
sen.e: Kyoto Kotsu Corporation is a company that operates buses in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyoto Kotsu Corporation is a company that operates buses in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyoto Kotsu Corporation is a company that operates buses in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 本社は京都府舞鶴市大字喜多小字新宮1048番地27、登記の本店は大阪府大阪市淀川区野中北一丁目2番15号（大タク内）。
sen.e: The head office is located at 1048-27 Shingu, Kita, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and on the registration paper the address of the head office is Daitaku Corporation nai 1-2-15 Nonakakita, Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 大字Oaza小字Koazaは現在は住民も使わないので省略します。
sen.e: The head office is located at 1048-27 Shingu, Kita, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and on the registration paper the address of the head office is Daitaku Corporation nai 1-2-15 Nonakakita, Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

The head office is located at 1048-27 Shingu, Kita, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and on the registration paper the address of the head office is Daitaku Corporation nai 1-2-15 Nonakakita, Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 会社更生法により更生手続中のバス事業者・京都交通 (亀岡)（本社・京都府亀岡市）から舞鶴支社（京都府北部地域）の営業を譲り受けるために、日本交通 (大阪)の子会社として設立された。
sen.e: It was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City) to take over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture from the Maizuru office of Kyoto Kotsu (the head office was located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture) which had gone the Corporate Rehabilitation Law.

It was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City) to take over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture from the Maizuru office of Kyoto Kotsu (the head office was located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture) which had gone the Corporate Rehabilitation Law.

It was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City) to take over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture from the Maizuru office of Kyoto Kotsu (the head office was located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture) which had filed for protection under the Corporate Rehabilitation Law.
sen.cmt: which had gone the Corporate Rehabilitation Law→had filed for protection under the Corporate Rehabilitation Lawに変更

sen.j: 2006年3月21日には舞鶴市の喜多工業団地内に本社機能を持たせた事務所と車両整備工場が新設された。
sen.e: March 21, 2006: The head office and a maintenance plant opened on Kita industrial estate in Maizuru City.
March 21, 2006: The head office and a maintenance plant opened on Kita industrial estate in Maizuru City.
March 21, 2006: The head office and maintenance facility opened on the Kita industrial estate in Maizuru City.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 2004年(平成16年)：日本交通 (大阪)の子会社として新京都交通（本店登記は大阪府大阪市淀川区）を設立。
sen.e: In 2004, Shin Kyoto Kotsu (on the registration paper, the address of the head office was in Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka prefecture) was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City).
In 2004, Shin Kyoto Kotsu (on the registration paper, the address of the head office was in Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka prefecture) was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City).
In 2004, Shin Kyoto Kotsu (on the registration paper, the address of the head office was in Yodogawa Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) was founded as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu (Osaka City).

sen.j: 2005年(平成17年)4月1日：京都交通 (亀岡)から京都府北部の路線（舞鶴支社運行路線で、綾部市内の路線の大部分を除く）を譲り受ける。
sen.e: April 1, 2005: It took over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (except most of the services in Ayabe City) from Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City).
April 1, 2005: It took over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (except most of the services in Ayabe City) from Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City).

April 1, 2005: It took over the bus services in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (areas serviced by the Maizuru office except most of the areas serviced in Ayabe City) from Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City).
sen.cmt: 「舞鶴支社運行路線で」を追加

sen.j: 京都交通に社名変更。
sen.e: It changed the company's name to Kyoto Kotsu.
It changed the company's name to Kyoto Kotsu.
It changed the company's name to Kyoto Kotsu.

sen.j: 東舞鶴営業所は舞鶴営業所に名称変更。
sen.e: It changed the name of the Higashi-Maizuru office to the Maizuru office.
It changed the name of the Higashi-Maizuru office to the Maizuru office.
It changed the name of the Higashi-Maizuru office to the Maizuru office.

sen.j: これにより、従来からの京都交通（京都交通 (亀岡)）と日本交通 (大阪)の子会社の京都交通（京都交通 (舞鶴)）という、資本関係の全く異なる2つの京都交通というバス会社が存在することとなったが、京都交通 (亀岡)が2005年(平成17年)7月1日に路線バス事業を京阪京都交通に譲渡しバス事業から撤退した為、2つの京都交通の状態は3か月で解消された。
sen.e: As the result, for the three months there had been two bus companies having the same name (Kyoto Kotsu) and different capital sources (Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City and Kyoto Kotsu in Maizuru City as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu), however, on July 1, 2005, Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City) gave up the bus services to Keihan-Kyoto Kotsu and withdrew completely from bus business.
sen.cmt: As the result, a strange situation occurred: two Kyoto Kotsu existed
sen.e: As the result, for the three months there had been two bus companies having the same name (Kyoto Kotsu) and different capital sources (Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City and Kyoto Kotsu in Maizuru City as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu), however, on July 1, 2005, Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City) gave up the bus services to Keihan-Kyoto Kotsu and withdrew completely from bus business.

As the result, for the three months there had been two bus companies having the same name (Kyoto Kotsu) and different capital sources (Kyoto Kotsu in Kameoka City and Kyoto Kotsu in Maizuru City as a subsidiary of Nihon Kotsu), however, on July 1, 2005, Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka City) gave up the bus services to Keihan-Kyoto Kotsu and withdrew completely from bus business.

sen.j: 2005年(平成17年)7月15日：舞鶴 - 大阪（JR難波駅）間、舞鶴 - 神戸（三ノ宮駅）間の高速バス2路線を運行開始。
sen.e: July 15, 2005: It began operating a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Osaka (JR Nanba Station), and a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Kobe (Sannomiya Station).
July 15, 2005: It began operating a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Osaka (JR Nanba Station), and a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Kobe (Sannomiya Station).
July 15, 2005: It began operating a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Osaka (JR Nanba Station), and a highway bus that ran between Maizuru and Kobe (Sannomiya Station).

sen.j: 2006年(平成18年)3月20日：福知山地区の市内北循環線を廃止。
sen.e: March 20, 2006: It abolished Kita junkansen Route (the north circuit bus route) in Fukuchiyama district.
March 20, 2006: It abolished Kita junkansen Route (the north circuit bus route) in Fukuchiyama district.
March 20, 2006: It abolished Kita junkansen Route (the north circulation route) in Fukuchiyama district.

sen.j: 2006年(平成18年)3月21日：市場車庫と市場車庫内にあった舞鶴営業所、京田事務所、愛宕車両整備工場を廃止し、本社機能と舞鶴営業所、車両整備工場、車庫を喜多工業団地内に移転竣工。
sen.e: March 21, 2006: It closed the Ichiba bus shed, the Kyoda office and the Atago maintenance plant, moved the Maizuru office (the practical head office) from the Ichiba bus shed to Kita Industrial Estate, and opened a new maintenance plant and a bus shed on Kita Industrial Estate.
sen.cmt: The former Maizuru office had been located in the Ichiba bus shed (like some gas stations).
sen.e: March 21, 2006: It closed the Ichiba bus shed, the Kyoda office and the Atago maintenance plant, moved the Maizuru office (the practical head office) from the Ichiba bus shed to Kita Industrial Estate, and opened a new maintenance plant and a bus shed on Kita Industrial Estate.

sen.j: 併せて、路線バスダイヤを西舞鶴駅基点に一新。

sen.j: また、福知山 - 神戸（三ノ宮駅）間の高速バスを運行開始。

sen.j: 2006年(平成18年)11月26日：三宮駅バスのりばのオープンに併せ、高速バス「神戸三宮線」ダイヤを改正。

sen.j: 併せて要望の多かった舞鶴 - 大阪（JR難波駅）間の高速バスを1往復増発。

Maizuru Sightseeing Bus "Please"

sen.j: 西舞鶴駅と東舞鶴駅から発着。赤れんが博物館・舞鶴引揚記念館・五老スカイタワー・舞鶴港とれとれセンターなどを循環運転。
sen.e: It arrives and departs at Nishi-Maizuru-eki (West Maizuru Station) and Higashi-Maizuru-eki (East Maizuru Station) and stops at Aka-renga Hakubutsukan (Red Brick Museum), Maizuru Hikiage Kinenkan (Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum), Goro Sky Tower (Goro Observation Tower), Maizuru-ko Toretore Center (Maizuru Fishing Port Market), and other tourist spots..

It arrives and departs at Nishi-Maizuru-eki (West Maizuru Station) and Higashi-Maizuru-eki (East Maizuru Station) and stops at Aka-renga Hakubutsukan (Red Brick Museum), Maizuru Hikiage Kinenkan (Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum), Goro Sky Tower (Goro Observation Tower), Maizuru-ko Toretore Center (Maizuru Fishing Port Market), and other tourist spots..

It arrives and departs at Nishi Maizuru eki Station and Higashi Maizuru eki Station and stops at Aka-renga Red Brick Museum, Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum, Goro Sky Tower, Maizuru-ko Port Toretore Center (Maizuru Fishing Port Market), and other tourist spots..
